abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Fifth Power Project (Power V) in Ghana.
            The project was part of major economic recovery and
            expansion program, including public enterprise reform. The
            main objectives of Power V were to: continue ongoing sector
            policy reforms, which had begun to help improve the
            technical and commercial efficiency of Electricity
            Corporation of Ghana (ECG), enhance ECG's capability to
            deliver a reliable, economic supply of electricity to its
            customers, and assist Government of Ghana (GOG) in
            developing a long-term power sector development strategy and
            an electrification program. The project's outcome
            overall was satisfactory with respect to most of its
            technical and institutional objectives. International
            Development Association (IDA) performance overall was
            satisfactory. The performance of GOG and ECG was
            satisfactory overall. The major lessons learned in project
            implementation were the following: (a) Promoting
            commercialization in an adverse structural environment; (b)
            Performance management contract; (c) Structuring
            co-financing arrangements; (d) Streamlining the procurement
            process; and (e) Utility Finances.
